title: Teenage thug who left loving dad in coma boasted on Facebook that he 'sent him snoring hahaha'
text:
News Teenage thug who left loving dad in coma boasted on Facebook that he 'sent him snoring hahaha' Connor Jary was already on bail for breaking two men's jaws when he left Calvin McLellan with serious brain injuries in a one-punch attack Share Connor Jary left his victim for dead before taking to social media to tell his friends (Photo: Twitter/@Connor_Jary) Share Get daily   
A teenage thug who left a loving dad brain damaged while on bail for another brutal attack posted a message on Facebook boasting that he “sent him snoring, hahaha”. 
Connor Jary had already been arrested for breaking the jaws of two men because they refused to let him into a house to wash his hands. 
Following an all day drinking session, the then-17-year-old got into another confrontation outside a pizza shop in South Shields, Chronicle Live reports. 
After an exchange of words with Calvin McLellan, Jary followed him down a cut, squared up to him and punched him once, causing him to fall, bang his head and suffer devastating brain injuries. 
Jary then fled, leaving stricken Mr McLellan for dead and taking to Facebook to brag about what he had done while the victim lay badly injured on the ground. Read More Girl pulls out huge knife during street fight between two females in the middle of road Connor Jary was locked up for three years (Photo: Chronicle Live, Northumbria Police) 
A court heard he wrote comments including “Dropped some lad with a dig”, “He is on the floor snoring (followed by a laughing icon)”, “Sent him snoring hahaha” and “Proper freak mate”. 
Mr McLellan, who has two young daughters, suffered catastrophic brain injuries, had to have emergency surgery and remains in a coma more than six months on. 
As Jary was locked up for three years for inflicting GBH on the 30-year-old and breaking the jaws of the other two men from the earlier offence, Mr McLellan’s heartbroken mum told of her devastation. Read More Calvin Mclellan with daughter Masie-Sue (Photo: Newcastle Chronicle) Calvin Mclellan's mother says her life has been ruined (Photo: Newcastle Chronicle) 
In a victim statement read to Newcastle Crown Court, Susan Douglas said: “Until this my life was perfect but since this date my world has fallen apart. 
“I’m a broken woman and have a broken family. Our family will never be the same again. 
“I miss Calvin so much. I’m proud to say he is an amazing son and I’m proud of how he turned out. 
“He was a happy go lucky child and this continued into his adult life. All I want is to see him like this again. 
“I’m told if he does wake up he will never be the same as he was. 
“Calvin’s girls are very upset. I told them he was working away at first and we have not told them the true reason why he is in hospital. Newcastle Crown Court (Photo: Newcastle Chronicle) 
“They ask to see their father every day and become very upset when told they can’t. It will be a long time until they can see him. 
“Not only has he ruined my son’s life, but his daughters’ lives as well. 
“All we want is for him to wake up. I would even let the man who did this free if only he would wake up. 
“I know he will never be the same again. I will pray every night for Calvin to wake up. 
“All I want is my son back.” Like us on Facebook
